result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Otis D M Pirtle

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Order.
Received and Filed. Proposed Order
Exhibit 3- Flash drive filed with stipulation sheet.

Motion Hearing exhibits from 10/10/22 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 791
Received and Filed: Stipulation for Return/Destruction of Original Exhibits and Exhibit List

Defendant Otis D M Pirtle in court.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court with Legal Intern Meghan DeVol for Otis D M Pirtle.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court a motion to suppress hearing.  

Sworn for the State: Patrick Kaine (Wauwatosa Police Officer).  Exhibits 1 and 2 received.  Parties stipulate to Defense's exhibit 3.  Defense counsel will file a letter with exhibit attached and an Order for Court's signature approving admission of exhibit 3. 

Court holds colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to testify or not testify.  Mr. Pirtle chooses not to testify.  Closing arguments heard.  Court states findings of fact.  Defense's motion DENIED by the Court.  Defense requests a date for plea and sentencing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed. STATES RESPONSE MOTION
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Otis D M Pirtle in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear by video means. Defense has filed a motion. Court sets 09/19/2022 by 5:00 pm as the deadline for the State to file a response. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Received and Filed. MOTION TO SUPPRESS AND BRIEF IN SUPPORT OF MOTION

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Otis D M Pirtle in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state. Further, defense is requesting a Motion Hearing date. Court advises parties that she only sets motion hearings once one has been filed. Court schedules next court date for a Status Conference date and sets 07/11/2022 deadline for filing any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5.24.2022

10:49 AM Defendant Otis D M Pirtle in court with Attorney Colleen A Taylor; both appear by video.  Defendant Otis D M Pirtle in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Officer P. Kaine. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Otis D M Pirtle in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Otis D M Pirtle in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Otis D M Pirtle appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  
MCSO did not provide executed warrant at time of scheduling.  Defendant at MSDF.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Otis D M Pirtle not in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/30/22 @ 1:30p
